events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on February 28th, involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after review confirmed the incident involved the customer's car.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim and coordinate communications with the customer.
The customer received a prompt acknowledgement of the claim ensuring that the matter is being taken seriously.
The insurance company requested vehicle repair estimates, police report, and photos from the accident scene.
The customer submitted all the requested documents including the police report, repair quote, and accident photos.
Investigation began to verify the incident details, review submitted documents, and assess liability for the accident.
The investigation was successfully completed confirming the customer's vehicle was damaged due to the other driver's fault.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer covering repair costs in line with the repair shop's estimates.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the responsive service.
The claim was officially approved authorizing the insurance company to proceed with payment for the vehicle repairs.
Payment was issued to the customer's designated repair shop to cover all authorized repair expenses promptly.
The claim was closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and the customer had no further issues.
The claim file was archived within the system to maintain records of the completed auto accident insurance claim.
